I‚Äôve been in regular contact with RivCo health officials, community leaders & small business owners. NONE have asked for:

‚ùå Wind + solar tax credits
‚ùå Airline emission mandates
‚ùå Corporate board diversity mandates

The Speaker needs to focus on what our country NEEDS now.

Airlines have seen their business severely impacted through no fault of their own. They need our help, not new emission mandates Speaker Pelosi is demanding. ¬†Let‚Äôs focus on what we need to do to solve this crisis.

We are in a health care crisis, not an energy crisis. Yet, Speaker Pelosi is slowing down health care relief while she insists on tax credits for wind and solar energy. We can work on energy policies later. Right we need to help hospitals serve the most vulnerable among us.

Workers and businesses are hurting.¬† Congress needs to help.¬† But Speaker Pelosi is holding up relief because she wants to mandate that Corporate Boards increase diversity?! There is a time for that debate.¬† This isn‚Äôt that time.¬† Let‚Äôs get serious.

As announced earlier this week, Medicare, Medicaid, and all major health insurers will cover the cost of a #COVID19 test.

Positive #COVID19 tests conducted at public health labs are considered ‚Äúpresumptive positive‚Äù cases pending CDC confirmatory testing. Upon confirmation by the CDC, they are then referred to as ‚Äúconfirmed positive.‚Äù

The test typically involves taking a swab from deep in a patient‚Äôs nasal cavity to collect cells from the back of the nose. The sample is then sent to a lab, where it will be tested to determine if the patient‚Äôs cells are infected with the virus.
At least two commercial laboratories (Quest and LabCorp) have indicated availability of testing. Testing through commercial labs does not require CDC pre-approval.
